channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 876 new coronavirus cases in Singapore; 3 are Singaporeans and PRs
item.description:
May 10, 2020 3:11 PM

This brings the total number of cases in Singapore to 23,336.

item.title: Free cakes for 32 mums of kids with special needs on Mother's Day, online expressions of gratitude
item.description:
May 10, 2020 2:11 PM

SINGAPORE - Chel Sie was just over a year old when she was diagnosed with a rare chromosome disorder, which had caused part of chromosome 18 to be deleted.

item.title: Coronavirus: All passengers to wear masks on SIA, SilkAir flights; meal services on flights to South-east Asia and China suspended
item.description:
May 10, 2020 11:58 AM

Meal services will be suspended on flights within South-east Asia and those servicing China.

item.title: SFA recalls mushroom products with excessive sulphur dioxide levels
item.description:
May 10, 2020 11:35 AM

SINGAPORE - Five types of mushroom products are being recalled after sampling has shown them to contain excessive levels of sulphur dioxide, which could potentially induce allergic reactions.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 10
item.description:
May 10, 2020 8:20 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, May 10.

item.title: Coronavirus: More consumers, companies embracing tech
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Digital banking was already gaining a strong foothold here but the lockdown is turbo-charging the process among individuals and businesses.

item.title: Earlier SunTimes report did not give the full picture
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Our Sunday Times report on April 19 on how low-income families were affected by the Covid-19 pandemic included an article headlined "$200 left with family of 6 to get through 3 weeks".

item.title: Home-grown firms linked to pandemic work will continue to attract demand, investments
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's expertise in the health and biomedical sciences that it has painstakingly built up over the years is paying off now, not just in helping the nation battle the coronavirus but also in providing a bright spot in the economy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Nursing homes in Singapore get a hand with swab tests, training
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Nursing homes are getting reinforcements in their battle against Covid-19, with Singapore's three healthcare clusters helping to train their staff and carry out swab tests.

item.title: Covid-19: A defining moment for baby boomers
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

I am of the lucky baby boomer cohort born after World War II and before the mid-1960s. It is a generation that has never experienced a world war and grew up during the longest sustained period of prosperity the world has ever known.

item.title: Prawn shells, fruit waste combine to find new life as food packaging
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Prawn shells, orange peels and apple cores get tossed into the bin every day without a second thought.

item.title: Fresh pastures in the Covid-19 economy: From supermarkets to remote-working tools
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

While the pandemic has upended some businesses, it has boosted others.

item.title: Strict measures for firms to prevent new wave of coronavirus
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

It will be mandatory for all offices and even canteens to ensure that workers do not stand close together, to limit the chance of a coronavirus resurgence as the Singapore economy gradually opens up.

item.title: Banker and wife donate $500,000 to ST School Pocket Money Fund
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Veteran banker Edmund Koh and his wife Wong Poh Choo have donated $500,000 to The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF) to celebrate Mother's Day today.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some laundry shops in Singapore may not reopen since offices remain closed
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Laundry companies will take tentative steps in reopening for business from May 12, saying they have to iron out some details first, such as establishing footfall where they are located.

item.title: Once Singapore's most wanted, gangster Roland Tan dies after 51 years on the run
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The 72-year-old, who was wanted for a 1969 Bras Basah murder, died of a heart attack in Denmark.

item.title: Schemes to help families tide over Covid-19 crisis: Key highlights
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

New schemes have been launched and existing ones enhanced to help lower-income families affected by Covid-19. Here are some key highlights. More details are available here.

item.title: Coronavirus: How Singapore's hair salons, bakeries, laundry shops are preparing to resume business from May 12
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A cautious rollback of the current circuit breaker to tackle the coronavirus outbreak from Tuesday will see more shops back in business.

item.title: Field notes from the middle of a pandemic
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

While we are in this Pause mode of life, it might be good to think about what living in the midst of a great pandemic is teaching us and think through what we might want to do differently when this is over, says Chua Mui Hoong.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bakeries in Singapore securing fresh ingredients ahead of May 12 start
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Last month, home baker Adeline Tan, 23, was so short on speculoos, a type of spiced cookie, that she had to buy them from a German market - at almost double FairPrice's usual price.

item.title: It Changed My Life: Hitting the sweet spot
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr John Cheng is getting excited talking about developments in the Singapore food landscape.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hair salons in Singapore get ready for expected influx of customers ahead of reopening
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Regular customers of Ezen Hair, Nail & Beauty salon have been calling to ask when it would reopen, as some of them grow increasingly desperate for a haircut.

item.title: The challenge and the promise of the post-Covid-19 economy
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Over the years, economists have talked of the "post-war economy", the "post-industrial economy" and the "post-Brexit economy". Now they are talking about the "post-Covid-19 economy".

item.title: 753 new coronavirus cases bring tally to 22,460 in Singapore
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Seniors aged 60 and older made up five out of the nine new Covid-19 cases among Singaporeans and permanent residents yesterday.

item.title: Home cooking whets increasing appetite for grocery shopping
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Sectors across the economy are feeling the pinch amid the circuit breaker period. But supermarkets are bucking the downturn - by feeding the trend of households where families may now have little choice but to cook at home.

item.title: Covid-19 facility at Tanjong Pagar Terminal begins receiving workers
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A facility built at Tanjong Pagar Terminal to house patients or migrant workers with the coronavirus started receiving workers last Tuesday.

item.title: Spike in demand for gaming chairs, streaming services, meetings software
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Zoom, Secretlab, Cast, SmartUC Mobile - tech terms that would have baffled most Singaporeans a month ago are now part and parcel of the nation's conversation as employees and students are forced to knuckle down at home.

item.title: Coronavirus: MPs, volunteers find new ways of reaching out
item.description:
May 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Coping during the circuit breaker period could be sometimes lonely and difficult for Madam Izamzamah Kusmon, 49, a single mother and caregiver to her 68-year-old mother, who suffers from a heart disease.
